titleproper.value: Guide to the Joseph Gordon Papers <num>TAM.082</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-05-02T16:00:06</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: Separated from the American Committee for Cultural Freedom Records, this two box collection contains typed and handwritten manuscripts, articles, papers, and notes written by Joseph Gordon as well as correspondence.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Joseph Gordon Papers; TAM 082; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.031.
Joseph Gordon worked for the Library of Jewish Information, the American Jewish Committee and was the author of many studies on East European affairs.

According to the original folder titles, Joseph Gordon often wrote under two different pseudonyms: Josef Guttman and Peter Meyer. Box 1 contains materials written by Joseph Gordon as himself and also as Josef Guttman. Box 2 is entirely devoted to the writings of Joseph Gordon as Peter Meyer. Both boxes contain typed and handwritten "manuscripts." Materials are not separated by language, so some folders may contain material in several different languages.

corpname.value: United States. Dept. of State. International Information Administration
